I was proud today that H.R. 5440 passed the House. It will hold the IRS accountable for putting its customers - U.S. taxpayers - first, ensuring help is available when one of the 300+ Taxpayer Assistance Centers across the country is closed.

This time next year, in addition to most Americans paying less in taxes, taxpayers will find the process of filing their returns easier and less daunting. 

But Tax Day will still come in April 2019 & people across the country will still turn to the IRS for help with their taxes.
There's good news, though. This is the last time any of us will file using the outdated code.

Tax Day could be a day of anxiety for families across America, particularly for those who owe money to the IRS. 

Either way, it's a day of frustration. Americans spent roughly $100 billion complying with IRS regulations over recent years.

The last Tax Day using an outdated, inefficient code designed for the 20th Century.

In #GA6, the average family of four is making an extra $4,420 this year, using the standard deduction. https://t.co/BXy0yTT4wj

Today, his family, friends and the world say goodbye to Reverend Graham for a final time. 

As he once said, "The will of God will not take us where the grace of God cannot sustain us."  

These words, his words, are how I will remember Reverend Billy Graham.

As Speakerl Ryan said this week, "Billy Graham woke up every day & shared his love of God. That love had no end. That love had no barriers."

Graham worked alongside Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. & other Civil Rights activists fighting for racial equality in America in the 50s & 60s
In his 99 years of life, Billy Graham preached the Gospel to an estimated 215 million people.  His sermons were translated into 48 languages and broadcast across more than 185 countries.
Reverend Billy Graham is just the fourth private citizen to lie in honor in the U.S. Capitol Rotunda.  It was a privilege to pay my respects to him on Wednesday morning.

@finkedith Last night's vote reauthorized CHIP for 6 years - the longest reauthorization in CHIP's history.

On November 3, however, I also voted for, and the House passed, a 5-year CHIP reauthorization. It passed 242-174, with the support of 15 Democrats, and failed to move in the Senate

But that is not enough. Now, we need a long-term budget that funds our military and the rest of the government as we continue to work towards a responsible solution on the immigration issues we face in this country.

This unnecessary shutdown put in jeopardy health insurance for nearly 9 million vulnerable American children, while delaying pay for more than 2 million U.S. troops as they fight to defend this country all over the world.

The shutdown did not need to happen. Tonight, it is over.
Tonight, after Senate Democrats ended their filibuster, the Senate passed a CR to reopen the government. Just hours later, I voted in favor of the same Continuing Resolution.

The Senate has taken a step closer to reopening the government by voting 81-18 to begin debate on its spending bill.

I urge them to act swiftly to pass the CR, reopen the federal government, and end the #SchumerShutdown as soon as possible.

Shutting down the government, putting millions of our troops - and 230,000 Georgia children reliant on CHIP - in danger because of demands unrelated to the federal budget is reckless and irresponsible.

In 2013, Senator Chuck Schumer said this regarding the shutdown of the federal government:
 
"The basic line is: No matter how strongly one feels about an issue, you shouldnâ€™t hold millions of people hostageâ€¦ Thatâ€™s wrong and we canâ€™t give in to that.â€

https://t.co/qDKKvj2hAx

Thatâ€™s money that will come straight from their own pockets.
When the shutdown began at midnight Saturday, these men & women became responsible for costs they incurred traveling to cancelled trainings.
Because of the #SchumerShutdown, 90,000 National Guardsmen and 20,000 Army Reservists have had their training cancelled this weekend.

The #SchumerShutdown won't prevent our active duty military men and women from continuing their work across the world. 

It will just prevent them from being paid until Senate Democrats remember who they work for in Congress.
The #SchumerShutdown is totally unnecessary, and Senate Democrats need to stop holding the govt hostage over issues unrelated to the budget
2 million military members-particularly reservists-wonâ€™t be paid until the shutdown ends & 50% of the civilian workforce will be furloughed

Thank you to the conferees of the #TaxCutsandJobsAct.Excited to give tax cuts to all groups of Americans & pass this bill into law next week

Finally, the #ProsperAct strengthens America's workforce development programs by prioritizing industry-led earn-and-learn programs that lead to high-wage, high-skill, and high-demand careers. 

Ultimately, a 21st century Economy demands a 21st century education system.

Critically, the #ProsperAct also increases options to non-traditional career & work study programs. It does this, among other things, by doubling current funding for Federal Work Study program and by lifting restrictions on students receiving training at private sector companies.

As tuition rates continue to skyrocket across the U.S., outstanding student loan debt has exceeded $1 trillion. 

At the same time, we have 6 million unfilled skills-based jobs, a number expected to reach 11 million by 2022.

Above all, the #ProsperAct aims to fill those gaps.

This week in the House @EdWorkforce Committee, I helped pass a bill designed to bring our higher education system into the 21st Century.
The #ProsperAct streamlines all federal student aid-simplifying FAFSA & injecting transparency regarding tuition affordability into the process
From the beginning, reducing the tax burden on hardworking Americans and middle class families has been our number one priority. And nothing has changed. https://t.co/dEALdJOQQx

full_text:
Our economy is running at its full potential for the 1st time in years

It's also the 1st time actual GDP has exceeded its potential since 2007-when President Bush was in office

Great news for America, and we can still do better. That starts w/ #TaxReform
https://t.co/olA1WStCh5

We still have some steps to go. Ultimately, however, I am confident the final bill that passes the House and gets the President's signature will be a net positive for working families and business owners of #GA6, creating stronger growth, more jobs and higher wages.

In the coming weeks, there will be conversations about changes to improve the #TaxCutsAndJobsAct as work to find compromise btwn the House & Senate. One change was already made, restoring the adoption tax credit for families opening their homes to children from around the world.

I was proud to support the #TaxCutsAndJobsAct, which passed the House by a 227-205 vote. With this bill, we're lowering income rates for all lower & middle income Americans, doubling the standard deduction, increasing the child tax credit, and preserving the adoption tax credit.

The #TaxCutsAndJobsAct is about more than tax cuts - it's about simplifying a tax code that is 75,00 pages long, that favors specific industries over another, and that has distorted economic decision making in America for decades. The status quo is simply not good enough.
Additionally, 26,877 taxpayers in #GA6 are impacted by the AMT every year. That's nearly twice the national average. The #TaxCutsAndJobsAct eliminates the AMT.

According the @USChamber, the #TaxCutsAndJobsAct will lead to the creation of an additional 975,000 jobs across the country, and will generate economic growth sufficient to increase federal tax revenue by 1 trillion dollars.
The #TaxCutsAndJobsAct nearly doubles the standard deduction. That means the first $24,000 in annual income will be tax free for every married couple that files using the standard deduction.

According to the @USChamber, the average family of 4 in #GA6 makes $132,066 per year. The #TaxCutsAndJobsAct will put $4,658 more annually in that family's bank account by using the standard deduction.

In #Georgia, the @USChamber projects the #TaxCutsAndJobsAct will create an additional 29,521 jobs. WHAT'S MORE... in #GA6, the average family of 4 will take home an extra $4,658 per year by taking the standard deduction rather than itemizing when they file their taxes.

Roughly 72,050 taxpayers in #GA6 have small business income. The #TaxCutsAndJobsAct lowers small business taxes to their lowest levels since WWII. With these tax cuts, we're working to spur growth of small businesses, which account for 64% of all new private-sector jobs in the US
And the fact that the Child Tax Credit IS a credit â€“ rather than a deduction â€“ means this money goes in your pocket whether you itemize or not.

The #TaxCutsAndJobsAct increases the Child Tax Credit from $1,000 to $1,600 per child - and it raises the creditâ€™s income threshold from $110,000 to $230,000. Over 40,000 taxpayers in #GA6 already claim this credit, and even more would be able to use it if this bill becomes law.

Such great, tireless work @RepKevinBrady and his entire team at @WaysandMeansGOP have done as they've sought to craft a bill that lowers the tax burden on the average American at every income level. And that's exactly what the #TaxCutsAndJobsAct does. Thank you all. https://t.co/fSuNFGYUTZ
